resources.string: The alpha filter returns a weighted sum of the new sensor value and old sensor value. Raising the value of alpha will give more weight to the accelerometer data and allow for more responsive controls. Decreasing alpha will give more weight to the previous filter value and allow for smoother controls.

The Simple Moving Average (SMA) Filter returns the average of the last N number of sensor values. Raising N increases the number of values that will be averaged and allow for smoother controls. Decreasing N lessens the number of values that will be averaged and allow for more responsive controls.
Noise returned by the accelerometer will not be filtered out, but the controls will be very responsive and allow for more sudden movements.
Alpha can be range from 0.01 to 1.
The number of values N can range from 1 to 5.
